page.title: 10Housing in Stithians.
page.content: Stithians is almost entirely residential with a large variety of properties. Some of the houses are over a hundred years old. There are bungalows, terraced, detached and semi-detached houses, usually lived in by owner occupiers. There are two council estates as well as a new private estate which is still being built.Some tenants from the council estate near the church have started buying their houses.There is also some property which is let privately all the year round and some which is rented out to holiday makers.All the houses have gardens, though some, especially on the council estates, are quite small. There are no factories or blocks of flats, though there are a few flats where a large property has been converted. The shops are converted houses.
